byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Joshua Jamerson, Michael Schwirtz, Daniel E. Slotnik and John Surico.
byline.original: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL and J. DAVID GOODMAN

abstract: New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton says Officer Randolph Holder has died after being shot in head by gunman in East Harlem; Holder is fourth officer killed on duty in past 11 months; suspect is in custody.
lead_paragraph: Randolph Holder, 33, was shot in the head around 8:30 p.m. Tuesday near Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive and 120th Street, and a suspect was in custody, the police commissioner said.

headline.main: New York Police Officer Dies After Being Shot in East Harlem
headline.print_headline: Officer Is Fatally Shot While Responding to a Robbery in East Harlem

snippet: Randolph Holder, 33, was shot in the head around 8:30 p.m. Tuesday near Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive and 120th Street, and a suspect was in custody, the police commissioner said.
